result.execSummary:
The defendant Edward R Willis was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations including costs of supervision during the term of probation.   If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

Any counseling deemed appropriate by agent. No firearms on premises or on person. Defendant may not rent them, borrow them or bring them on his property. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations while on probation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Edward R Willis

Defendant Edward R Willis in court with attorney Joe Edward Kremkoski.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
The State is Ch. 950 compliant. The State files an amended information. Defense acknowledges receipt of same and enters NG plea. Ct 1 DRI, deft will plead to Ct 2. The State recommends probation with approp conditions.
P-NC
COP filed, rights given
the deft waives right to JT
the State relies on comp for FB - defense stipulates to same
finding of guilt

Defense is asking that weapons that were confiscated be returned to his son. The State indicates that due to the charge, the weapons will not be returned.

BTC: guilty as above. sent w/held - 1 yr probation. Firearms will not be returned
Pocket knife may be returned to the defendant

Conditions:
obey all rules and regs
costs
DNA costs
any counseling deemed approp by agent
no firearms on premises or person. May not rent them, borrow them or bring them on his property

Defendant Edward R Willis in court with attorney Joe E. Kremkoski.  Robert Scott Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense indicates that deft was previously hospitalized. Defense indicates that matter is expected to be resolved short of trial. The State agrees. Parties ask for STC in 30-45 days  Status conference scheduled for December 16, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Ct 1: 941.30(1)-First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety; Ct 2: 947.01(1)-DC, use of Dangerous Weapon. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.    Do not drive at all.  No contact with the victim, KW, (person, property, residence or family).  No violent contact with any other family members or any other citizenry. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

AMENDED 10-03-2014. Defendant may have no violent contact with grandsons and contact must be supervised. Defendant may drive as long as he is properly licensed in the State of Wisconsin
Status conference on November 3, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Edward R Willis in court with attorney Joe E. Kremkoski.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense motions for modification of bond and the Court has the comp eval. Defense is asking that deft have contact with his grandchildren and to allow deft to drive if properly licensed. Defense withdraws claim of competency and asks that CH be removed from the Court's calendar. The State does not object to the bond modifications

BTC: the Deft may have no violent contact w/grandchildren with supervision and deft may drive as long as he is properly licensed.  Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2014 at 10:30 am. Due to the defense withdrawing CH claim the Court finds the defendant is competent to proceed.

Ct 1: 941.30(1)-First Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety; Ct 2: 947.01(1)-DC, use of Dangerous Weapon. Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.    Do not drive at all. Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.
Competency hearing on October 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Edward R Willis in court with attorney Carolyn Hillery Delery.  Defendant Edward R Willis in custody.  Robert S. Repischak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Patricia Schaefer.
Defense withdraws bond motion but requests competency eval. The Defense asks that the comp eval be done in the hospital as deft has some medical issues. 
In light of the Court's decision, the defense now renews their motion for bond modification with a no contact prohibition so deft can go home. The State would like to see the evaluation before he makes a decision regarding bond.

BTC: Competency evaluation is ordered. There is no basis for this Court to transfer deft to a hospital and it will not be ordered. Bond to be modified to $1000.00 cash - condition to include no contact with victim and no violent contact with any other members of his family or any other citizenry. Time limits are waived for preliminary hearing and that matter will be removed from the calendar.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 10, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
ATTY Delery files motion for modification of bond.
Preliminary hearing on September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  Defendant ordered not to possess or control any weapons.    Do not drive at all.  No contact with the victim, KW, (person, property, residence or family).   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

Defendant Edward R Willis in court with attorney Nhu Huong Tran.  Defendant Edward R Willis in custody.  Rebecca L Sommers appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Pat Phinisee.  Reading of complaint is waived, probable cause found, bond set.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 11, 2014 at 08:30 am.
